intro: Oxybasis rhombifolia, commonly known as the diamondleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Oxybasis rhombifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
